thread.title: Lamar Odom is awake and responding to wife Khloe Kardashian in hospital
thread.title_full: Lamar Odom is awake and responding to wife Khloe Kardashian in hospital

title: Lamar Odom is awake and responding to wife Khloe Kardashian in hospital
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Lamar Odom is awake and responding to wife Khloe Kardashian in hospital Lamar Odom was awake and responsive to communicative attempts from his estranged wife Khloe Kardashian at a Las Vegas hospital on Friday morning, according to Odom’s college basketball coach Jim Harrick. Post to Facebook Lamar Odom is awake and responding to wife Khloe Kardashian in hospital Lamar Odom was awake and responsive to communicative attempts from his estranged wife Khloe Kardashian at a Las Vegas hospital on Friday morning, according to Odom’s college basketball coach Jim Harrick.  //on.11alive.com/1LytMVo   Join the Conversation To   Lamar Odom is awake and responding to wife Khloe Kardashian in hospital USA Today Network Martin Rogers, USA TODAY Sports 4:52 p.m. EDT October 16, 2015 Lamar Odom warms up prior to the game against the Dallas Mavericks. (Photo: Matthew Emmons, USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
LAS VEGAS – Lamar Odom was awake and responsive to communicative attempts from his estranged wife Khloe Kardashian at a Las Vegas hospital on Friday morning, according to Odom’s college basketball coach Jim Harrick. 
In a telephone conversation with USA TODAY Sports, Harrick said that Kardashian, who married the former NBA player in 2009, had texted details of a strong improvement in Odom’s condition. 
“She reached down and said ‘you know I love you’ and he kind of nodded,” Harrick said. “Three or four days after being scared to death and fearing the worst, that is a little hope, a little progress. She texted me that (information).” Deep in desert sits brothel where Lamar Odom collapsed 
Harrick became a father figure to Odom during the 6-10 forward’s time at Rhode Island University, where he played basketball for one season before entering the NBA draft in 1999. 
Odom has been at Sunrise Hospital in Las Vegas since Tuesday, having been taken to the facility after being found unresponsive following a three-day binge that allegedly involved cocaine use at a Nevada brothel called the Love Ranch.
